website_summaries.verdict: An affordable smart lock that gives you easy access but keeps your home secure.
pros: With your phone as the key, you can automatically unlock and lock your door when you enter and leave range
The app tracks access and saves user activity
cons: Some users experienced problems with Bluetooth connectivity, which delayed entry

website_summaries.verdict: August's Smart Lock is a decent entry-level smart lock that performs well and offers a lot for its price.
pros: August's third-generation Smart Lock comes with a DoorSense open/close sensor and works with Amazon Alexa speakers and the Google Home for just $149
cons: The Smart Lock doesn't work with Apple HomeKit or Z-Wave
Its lock motor is a little noisy

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable device
customer_reviews.text: Not reliable, have to bring physical key all the time. 1.manual lock/unlock: a) My phone has over 50% chances not able to connect the lock. b) my wife's phone has 10-20 % chances not able to connect. c) my son's phone always works 2. auto unlock: a) my phone works only twice in the past 5 weeks b) my wife's phone works about 50% of the time c) my son's phone works over 90% of the time 3. auto lock: disabled
customer_reviews.author: Charles Z

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY FROM AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: 1 you must purchase the wifi bridge (80$ on amazon) with this lock in order for it to connect to your phone if you are farther away than 10ft. Lock is solid idea and great but PURCHASE from August.com NOT I repeat NOT amazon. August will give you a discount if you email or call and ask and it is way way way way cheaper than amazons price. I contacted customer service to request they just price match August and they refused. It will be one of the reasons I am steering away from purchasing any item sold by amazon. They have a corporate mentality and are unwilling to work with people. Will definitely be returning my product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The idea works, but the product doesn't
customer_reviews.text: The lock works fine when it works, however mine is really a battery drainer. We use it about once per day, and we need to replace the battery almost every other week. That is not user-friendly at all. Imagine you are locked out of the house every 10 days because you don't change the batteries every week. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C Wang

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Battery Life (3 day)
customer_reviews.text: I am hoping that my product was just defective, I am returning it promptly. This device takes 4 AA batteries and even with adjusted settings so that it wasn't locking or unlocking automatically (though these are features I would have liked to use) the batteries only lasted for 3 days. I just cant fathom changing the batteries out two to three times a week for the duration just to use this lock.
customer_reviews.author: sbark

customer_reviews.title: So so simple to install
customer_reviews.text: This thing was incredibly easy to install, no wires to hook up no major locksmith knowledge required. All you need is a Phillips screw drive and which way to turn it to remove and then reinstall the screws of existing deadbolt. I received no product, no endorsement, and no compensation, nor any arm twisting for this honest review.
customer_reviews.author: Ryusho

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality But Know Your Deadbolt First
customer_reviews.text: I’m super sad but my deadbolt isn’t actually compatable with this lock. I didn’t know until I was trying to assemble. The instructions are awesome, and their customer service is amazing. I contacted them to discuss my lock and they couldn’t have been nicer. I included a photo of my deadbolt and the 3 only adapters that come with the lock. If you have a deadbolt like mine it will not work with the generation 3. Excellent quality but my deadbolt isn’t compatable. I still wanted to review the product because it is such good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Over all duality issue and app problem
customer_reviews.text: This is joke 😂 how can I connect without August Connect Wi-Fi Bridge White AC-R1 it feels like they want to make you buy extra $60 up to $80 for something that is "SMART" and it should come for free or maybe $20 charge ? I mean come on inside is plastic this won't even make your lock more secure it's all plastic junk inside useless to be honest when I'm getting several error if my phone is not connected to bluthooth or wife on phone goes on 5G instead of 2.4 I wouldn't recommend this August lock since it's not "SMART" at all and quality is very low for $100 up to $150 that you would spend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good keylock
customer_reviews.text: Its not reliable. I always have to double check to see if its locked. Half the time it doesnt lock so i have to spend literally 30secs to open it it. Key is faster...and it keeps getting stuck. Not reliable. Many nights when i locked it at night in my bedroom upstairs its unlocked. I would have my fromt door opened many nights bc it doesnt work well. Seriously its not reliable. If you read this i would recommend other brands.
customer_reviews.author: kayjay

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the deceit of pairing one lock to one hub
customer_reviews.text: The August lock while easy to use is a shell game - for each lock they make you buy a wireless hub. This is the biggest con of any smart home vendor and people are better advised to look somewhere else. I got fooled because one assumes that a WiFi hub could be used by multiple August locks and much to my surprise it isn’t a correct assumption. August is essentially playing fast & loose by pairing one WiFi hub with one lock and this is one of the most insidious and deceitful product pairings have seen in the last several years. Avoid if you can
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Works 50% of the time
customer_reviews.text: My house is loaded with smart gadgets. My lights, window blinds, TV, stereo are smart controlled. Even my car (a Tesla) can be controlled from my phone. By far the most unreliable device in the system is this lock. 50% of the time coming home I have to stand at my door trying to re-connect my phone to this lock. It is annoying that every time I finally get it open, there is a message for me to upgrade to their Pro version. DO NOT BY THIS THING. You have been warned!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Latest firmware update version 1.12.2 makes this lock useless and dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: It was working fine until the latest firmware update which is version 1.12.2. Now it just intermittently won't auto lock, which is dangerous, and the "door sense" system sometimes thinks the door is open and locked when it's actually closed and locked. I've tried recalibrating it twice and even replaced the batteries but it didn't help. I can not recommend this smart lock until they fix this bug with another firmware update.
customer_reviews.author: MKhuu

customer_reviews.title: Auto unlock rarely works
customer_reviews.text: This is a 3rd generation product that still rarely works like it should. Auto unlock is a joke, it works maybe 5% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I've had nothing but problems with this lock, my phone never connects automatically and I have to "repair lock connection" every time I want to lock or unlock the door. I've reached out to them about my issues multiple timea and have never received a response. Maybe the upgraded versions are better, but this one is complete garbage compared to other products on the market
customer_reviews.author: K. Strube

customer_reviews.title: Very cool lock.
customer_reviews.text: Super cool lock. I don't even carry a house key anymore; although I probably should just in case. The lock detects my proximity and either locks or unlocks when I'm at 150ft or so. It connects on Apple Watch and has features for AirBnB or permanent guests. The other nice thing about it is the exterior appearance of your door stays the same, so it's not obvious for outsiders that you have this lock. The additional equipment needed for remote control is pretty cool too; will probably add that later.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Pullen

customer_reviews.title: New house - New August
customer_reviews.text: I tried other locks because my new one didn't have a deadbolt. Was not satisfied with any of the others. So, I bought a Kwikset 660 Single Cylinder Deadbolt here on Amazon, drilled the holes, installed a deadbolt and then put on the August. THAT'S how comfortable and confident I am to use this. It works great and secure. I hear the latch when my son comes to visit because he's on the allowed list. Don't go cheap with other junk for secure lock - This is the only secure way to lock your door.
customer_reviews.author: Debra M

customer_reviews.title: Way better than Schlage.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t really attest to the quality of the app auto unlocking, I’ve only used it for testing purposes and to change settings. But I paired this with an August keypad and am truly grateful for the function and quality. August replaced the Schlage Connect I had one for the past year that was obnoxiously loud and unreliable (eventually the gears wore out and ceased to work at all). The August lock is insanely quiet, barely louder than using keys. It’s has yet to fail to unlock or lock and the keypad is super convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get fooled again!!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the part are cheap to plastic so I do not have faith in longevity of the product. It does not matter much as I does not work with Alexa unless I spend a rediculous amount of money on a hub. These sneaky tricks by amazon are becoming more common, be cautious of this lock. After my original review the lock did break within the first day. The return was not too difficult as long as it does not take too long to receive my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Disadvantage / Design Fault
customer_reviews.text: 1. August didn't consider very basic possibility of kids play around with lock and can remove the cover and battery easily. Little shake to the door will remove the battery cover, it's that loosely places on lock without screw or latch. 2. Keypad is placed on base plate like a toy battery cover. Can be removed by little push of plastic lock. It can be you annoying neighbor, a naughty kid or a thief and you or your guest can have nightmare standing outside house thinking where to type the pin.
customer_reviews.author: Caesar

customer_reviews.title: Auto-unlock doesn't really work
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for about $65 and definitely don't think it's worth even that. The auto-unlock was the main feature I wanted and it's terrible. My android phone - when it does work it autounlocks when I'm still a half mile from home (a neighborhood loop) and it only works like 20% of the time. My girlfriend's iphone - seemed to work well for a while but not working well anymore. OH and this lock isn't even compatible with all deadbolt manufacturers. I bought a super common $10 deadbolt at home depot and it wasn't compatible. I had to use a file to modify one of the plastic adapters to work with mine.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sturgis

customer_reviews.title: Not a WIFI lock without the $70 hub which is sold separately. Just Bluetooth. So just use your key if your that close
customer_reviews.text: Worked good but was under the impression it was wifi and can be opened from anywhere. But without the $70 hub which you have to buy separate you can only use the lock with Bluetooth. Maybe I should have researched it better but in the directions it says send an invite to anyone anywhere. But that's just an email that now they have to download the app and create an account and then use there Bluetooth when there in range of your lock. If I was within range I'd save the $125 and just open the door with a key. When in type in the search I typed WIFI DOOR LOCKS. NOT BLUETOOTH DOOR LOCKS.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. The inner piece has two “adjustable” pieces that are either weak aluminum or an ultra-thin stamped steel that immediately snapped when I began tightening up the bolts through them. No way this could possibly secure an entryway that anybody made half an attempt at getting in.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just have in mind of some possible problems to get it working.
customer_reviews.text: The installation gets pretty easy with the video instructions within the app, but it stills depends on the lock you are replacing and your personal ability for this DIY things. They lock itself works fine but beware that it may not lock all the way in (again it the depends on the bolt of your lock) and from time to time you will have connectivity issues, but if you get it working its really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Rubio

customer_reviews.title: Good for $50 or less
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Cyber monday for $45. For that, its worth it. For the full $150, probably not. Everything works ok. It sometimes doesn’t unlock before I get to door, but probably 90% of the time it does unlock without having to hit the button. My issue with the proximity unlock is that its based on geolocation and you have to leave 300m of ur house and return for it to trigger auto-unlock. So to walk ur dog around the neighborhood, sorry, it wont trigger. The auto-lock option is only by timer, so if u don’t have ur phone on u and u leave out the front, it will lock behind u and ur screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift for my partner. We've slowly been adding smart devices to our house over the past few years. We have the assistants and lights and screens but we were still using an old key to get into our house. I cannot tell you how nice it is to just be able to walk into your home (when carrying an army's worth of groceries) without even having to think about unlocking your door. It's already done for you when you get within range. I had to get the wifi bridge separate. You can't check the door or unlock it remotely without the bridge.
customer_reviews.author: James Brock

customer_reviews.title: Its ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: The auto unlock feature does not always work when i get home. It works about 80% of the time. When it works, its really nice, but there's always doubt that it may not auto unlock. When I'm not home it is annoying to be in my neighborhood, the app keeps notifying or asking me if im going home. Even if you say no, the notifications come back. Annoying that you need to purchase the wifi bridge to unlock when you are not at home.
customer_reviews.author: Samir Darras

customer_reviews.title: Lock only unlocks once automatically...
customer_reviews.text: i misunderstood How this lock worked. I thought as long as my phone was on me the lock would automatically unlock if I got so close. This is not how it works. What it will do is automatically unlock upon your return to the house. That feature is nice but let’s say you return home from work, then change your clothes and decide to walk to the street and get your mail. In this case the door is lock. So you have to take your phone out, open an app, click on the appropriate lock, and then wait for the app to locate the lock and hit unlock. Not a fan was going to return but I’m outside the window.
customer_reviews.author: Dj

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.....
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate this. My old dinosaur door lock worked much better. I thought I was going to be able to assign temporary passwords to guests (i.e. Airbnb) but this does not have the capability. Additionally, if you were out of town or at the grocery store for that matter, and have a house guest, you cannot simply unlock the door remotely. You have to purchase a bolt on which is $80. Even then, I've had many issues where I'm out of town and the app does not allow me to open the front door for guests as its designed to do. This is horrible. Also, i have it set to auto lock and it works 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: MLJ

customer_reviews.title: Much improved from version 1
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my last one. I have the original and needed the upgrade due to the motor being a bit under powered and the battery cover falling off. Neither problem exists with this new model. I had a bit of a hard time syncing my Wi-Fi/Bluetooth extender and the key pad, but that was due to my own fault. Remember to un sync everything from your old lock before you remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Todd L

customer_reviews.title: Great lock!! (Hub needs to be integrated in lock and not be a separate device)
customer_reviews.text: Really nice lock! The one drawback is that hub has to be purchased separately and be in line of sight of the lock! So if your doors are not positioned where one hub can see several doors then you have to purchase several hubs! This defies the purpose of WiFi!. Otherwise it works really great and has really nice features!!
customer_reviews.author: Cecil W.

customer_reviews.title: It's LOUD.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, you can hear this thing across my house. It's bad enough that I'm considering replacing it with a 3rd-gen Pro (have one, like it). Also, there are some who say that the Connect bridge will help you set this up with HomeKit. It won't. If you want to hack your through it, you can get a SmartThings hub and connect it with a plugin there, and then a Homebridge control of the SmartThings hub, but at that point, why not value your time and spend the extra money? (Unless you like a good project.)
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey F. Morris

customer_reviews.title: DoorSense calibration is off
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Just like the Smart Lock Pro the installation of the lock is pretty easy and it works fine Cons: The DoorSense keeps failing the calibration. I have installed it the same way I did for the Smart Lock Pro (flush mount) where it works without a hitch, but with this one the calibration fails (according to the Reddit thread I found it's the ajar state causing problems). Of course there's nothing in the August support to help troubleshoot that and the app won't provide anything more meaningful than "calibration failed".
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry

customer_reviews.title: God, grant me the serenity to try another "Smart" Lock after this one.
customer_reviews.text: Locks so well you'll find yourself locked out of your home at the most inopportune times, like those rare times when you're checking your mail or talking to a neighbor. Requires an act of God to convince Alexa to allow the unlock feature. Apparently God wasn't in my favor on this one and since Bluetooth is required even when you pay for the WiFi Connect box, I decided to return this "Smart" lock. Oh, and the app is a complete joke without the laughs. Did I mention this is NOT compatible with Apple HomeKit - even when you buy the Connect?
customer_reviews.author: Matty B

customer_reviews.title: Absolute crap
customer_reviews.text: ***update*** I’ve dropped this product down to 1 Star. It doesn’t work most of the time which is extremely frustrating. Even with the WiFi bridge this thing still refuses to work. Original review: I love the idea of this product but it’s extremely inconsistent. I even purchased the WiFi bridge and I still end up having to dig through my purse for my phone or keys to unlock the door. When it works, I love it! And I do love being able to check my phone to see if the door is locked. But the inconsistency is extremely frustrating. I don’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi DiMarco

customer_reviews.title: auto-unlock rarely works, unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The widget on iPhone, almost never responds to my input. Recently the auto-unlock-when-arriving-home feature has become unreliable. I'll often have to use my phone to unlock the door. Then once inside my home, I'll lock the door and a moment later it re-unlocks it. Very frustrating feeling like the lock is rebellious, and unsafe when the door unlocks after I have walked into my home and I don't notice it. The lock used to be very reliable but it's become more of a frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Good lock, not "smart" unless you go "Pro"
customer_reviews.text: I like the auto door lock feature and being able to check my app to lock/unlock, and make sure the door is closed and locked. Caution: the lock doesn't install on patio doors with Windows that have protruding frames next to the hardware. You need a flush mount space with a fairly large radius around the lock. Only 3 stars because I need the "Pro" version to actually use it as a smartlock with Alexa, Google Home, and remote access. The basic lock is simply a mechanical lock with an app. I can only use the lock with the app when I am in close physical proximity to the door.
customer_reviews.author: AARON

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it- needs a keypad.
customer_reviews.text: Good riddance! Replaced my keypad with this and it was awful. It didn’t unlock when it alerted me on arriving home that it unlocked the door. Then when I ran outside to send off my son and husband the door locked on me - and I was locked out in 29 degrees without a coat. Advice to August: these need to be sold with a keypad- not just as an optional add on but with every lock you sell.
customer_reviews.author: xds58

customer_reviews.title: NOT RELIABLE!
customer_reviews.text: Not reliable. It doesn't always Auto lock when i leave and it doesn't always Auto unlock when i approach my door. Considering this thing controls my front door and basically the security of my house, anything short of complete reliability is unacceptable. Recent update made it worse. App and installation was easy but i had to keep "repairing connection" by resetting and cycling my Bluetooth connection. And this was supposed to be the third generation of this product?! I'm amazed after three generations of this thing, this security product is so unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: tamafighting

customer_reviews.title: Smart Lock
customer_reviews.text: Love this smart lock from August, perfect when you are renting the place and cant replace the whole lock set. From outside nothing changes, no one would know you have a smart lock work just fine with good old key. Door sense is also amazing an feature I just sticked with white transparent tape. The only bug I found with the product is its auto unlock feature, it won't unlock the door majority of the time reason being when you go out of the your home's perimeter the feature on the app needs get up and remain awake till come back to unlock automatically, this is more of a sofware bug which I hope will be sorted sometime soon
customer_reviews.author: Kamal

customer_reviews.title: Helpful product, bluetooth unlock feature a little laggy
customer_reviews.text: Install is quick and easy. Remote/app lock/unlock and door closed sensor all work great. The Auto-unlock was (on LG V35 phone) hit and miss as to whether it worked at all. I'd regularly have to re-pair phone with lock. Then using iPhone XS, the auto-unlock works consistently but is often well delayed. About 33% of the time, I'm standing inside at my kitchen counter, having manually unlocked the door, when the auto-unlock mechanism kicks in.
customer_reviews.author: kly411

customer_reviews.title: I was looking forward to August SmartLock but...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to receiving the August SmartLock and August Connect. After easily installing the Smartlock and performing the setup, I next attempted to set up the August Connect. Following the instruction, I found that the August Connect got a strong WiFi signal but could not connect with the SmartLock via Bluetooth signal, as is indicated on the August app. After many retries, I finally contacted the Agust support team. After explaining the problem to the tech, he would only state that the August Connect will only connect to August SmartLock by WiFi but that is not what I read in the August literature. If any of the reviewers knows the correct answer, please leave answer. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: edmarch

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE if you need to give remote access to your house.
customer_reviews.text: Why get this product? Because I spent nearly $500 each time I go on vacay for Kenneling my pups. Hired the neighbor's daughter to feed and water and check on my pups. Now she has a virtual key to my house. I can schedule dates and times that give her access and it revokes her access outside that. I can unlock and lock my door from anywhere with the August Bridge. (MUST HAVE THIS TO UNLOCK AND LOCK FROM ANYWHERE NOT INCLUDED) even gives you a log to see whi entered and exited the house and when. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: JGraham

customer_reviews.title: The lock that will eventually lock you out!
customer_reviews.text: If a picture says 1000 words, a video should say more... just watch the video and see what you’re in for if you buy this thing. Oh, and if you call their customer service, be prepared to wait a long time... i was unable to get through to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second August Smart Lock. I went right to August because the first one one bought (still in operation) is great. August locks are sturdy, very easy install, and work with Alexa (using the Wi-Fi bridge). Should you need help during installation, the good folks at Amazon provide excellent assistance! In addition, if you would like a wireless keypad to operate the lock, the August model is excellent and quickly pairs with the lock.
customer_reviews.author: Cipher469

customer_reviews.title: August is cool!!
customer_reviews.text: The lock is terrific. We just purchased a home and having the August lock on the door and being able to give various contractors access without having to let them in or get extra keys cut makes our lives so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: A Guy From Burbank

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: This thing was awesome we used it on our rental apartment and was so easy to use especially when we got the connect device so it auto unlocks our house when walking up to the door. No more fishing for keys to get inside. When we moved out we just swapped the dead bolt part back on and took it to the new place. It was really nice to just tell alexa to lock the door at night no getting out of bed again to lock the door. She even reminds us if we set up a routine for night time and asks us if we meant to leave it unlocked 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: R Estabrook

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted this lock to work
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can keep your existing dead bolt but had problems with it staying powered on. I had to remove the batteries once a week and put them back in because the phones and key pads were unable to connect to it. Tried several sets of new batteries with the same result. I may have had a defective unit but not willing to take the chance again after being locked out of the house on more than one occasion. This is the 2nd August lock I've had, also had the key pad and doorbell. All stopped working within 2 yrs.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: We bought two
customer_reviews.text: We bought one for our front door to allow non family members access to our house without a key (e.g. dog walkers, house sitters). It's been great for monitoring when people come and go. It's easy to use, and the app is simple. My not-handy husband was able to install this easily. The one downside is that you can't use rechargeable batteries in this. Ultimately, we liked this so much that we got one for our back door, too. We have not gotten the wifi bridge in the year that we've had the setup-- I'm not even sure that we need it at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that I can unlock and unlock the door with my phone, as long as I'm close enough to lock or unlock it with my hand. So I don't have to carry a key. My hope was if someone was at the door I could see them on my doorbell and let them in. To do that with this I have to by a hub and dedicate a receptical to it. The hub is about the same cost as the door lock. Maybe WiFi is too powere hungry to use batteries. In which case the concept is not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bobo66

customer_reviews.title: Great lock and all functionality works just as expected...(Ignore negative reviews)
customer_reviews.text: This lock was extremely easy to install. The app works great, it’s intuitive and user friendly. All functionality that is listed works great and 100% of the time. I love it. I would really take any of these negative reviews with a boulder size grain of salt. And this goes for reviews of other products too. Not understanding how people have this many problems. Those must either be fake reviews or just flat out user error. Long story short, if you are looking for a great smart lock to add to your home this one fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product but be careful!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely need to buy the connect wi fi bridge. You can’t lock or unlock remotely without it. You can lock and unlock with your phone only if your phone is right there (Bluetooth). However, don’t have the auto lock feature turned in and then walk out of the house to take in the sunset because then it locks and you’re in trouble. Fortunately the app had loaded to my Apple Watch and the phone was in the vicinity close enough that I could unlock that way! Overall, I like this and installation was simple enough.
customer_reviews.author: tbench

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with new Kwikset lock
customer_reviews.text: Be sure you know the exact model of lock you have and that you cross reference with the August compatiblilty list (by Model, NOT just by brand) before you buy. It turns out August was not compatible with my new kwikset (most common lock brand) model 818 door hardware purchased a month ago at Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was a waste. To add the bells and whistles, you need to buy an extra part that connects this lock to your wifi. That would allow you to monitor the lock and get notifications, also allow remote access. Without it it's just a lock which unlocks with your smart phone vs a key.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: The product I bought looked great when it arrived. When I tried to sync with Alexa and register online, I was given an error message that it was already registered under a different name (??). I had to email the company, send them pictures of the item and wait for their response a few days later. They told me that it was now registered to me and to try again to sync. Still didn't work. I have the lock on my door but it doesn't even lock without a key. What a waste of $100!
customer_reviews.author: Ezzy theDJ

customer_reviews.title: "PREPARE TO BE......JAMMED!"
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with this lock however the ease of install was super easy. From the time I finished the install and tried to sync it up with the app, the lock continued to jam over and over again. I loosened up the lock a tad like the website troubleshooting guide advised, however the jamming continued. Amazon was amazing and issued a refund as soon as I sent it back. After this experience, Id love to try another August product as it's a great tool, but it's not going to be for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this lock with 1 exception. I want to be fair to this lock because it does what it says it does and very well. Was super easy to install and has made things much easier. With that said I feel selling a second way over priced device to make it work on the internet is a poor choice. For the price of this internet/bluetooth link device I can buy an Apple TV3, an Alexa on sale (which can also work the lock) etc. It almost feels like they want to encourage you not to buy their link device but instead invest in an Alexa. Which due to privacy concerns I have no interest in.
customer_reviews.author: Clint R.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. Customer support is useless.
customer_reviews.text: It works maybe 50% of the time. Unless you enjoy your door being left unlocked (when you have autolock timed for 90 seconds) and it sending you notifications that your door has been left open when it hasn't, you're better off with a different brand. It's worse than having a manual lock, because at least a manual lock doesn't give the expectation that it will do anything.
customer_reviews.author: CollegeGal

customer_reviews.title: Could have been better
customer_reviews.text: Quite easy to install as I had a compatible lock - took about 15 minutes to get it working, no problems. Had to think a bit to understand how the "auto lock" and "auto open" works. Once I figured them out, it works consistently Would have been great if the wifi integration was built into the device and not require another 70 USD - also, I could not use the coupon that they had offered on the app. Maybe there is a technical reason for the external wifi bridge, but requiring to buy one for each lock is disingenuous I wont remove it - as it works - but will not recommend it until the wifi bridge is built in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Leaving home and having it automatically lock works 100% of the time. But, coming home, it only automatically unlocks about 40% of the time -- even though I can take my phone out of my pocket, open the app and manually unlock it (although sometimes it has to rediscover it). I would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: WADE A CHESTNUT

customer_reviews.title: Great smart lock
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lock during Black Friday and very pleased with it. I use it on the door from my garage to my living room. I love that when I get home in my car and am within Bluetooth range, it automatically unlocks the deadbolt. The Automatic Auto-lock feature is pretty cool as well. You could configure it to a number of different time values. I don’t have the wi-if bridge, but find the basic features without the bridge sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made in years!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best invention of the past 5 years. You can't tell from the outside it's controlling the door. I can open my front door from anywhere. Best place is the garage before unloading groceries. NO more fumbling with keys or codes. I can open it when I'm tied up and know it's a friend (via security cam). I can even give them temporary access if they are OK with loading the app on their phone and taking their photo. (My neighbor was not... but that's OK.) Can't say enough about it.
customer_reviews.author: YTE

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This automatic lock is fantastic BUT make sure that you have a company representative on the phone when you install it. Even my professional needed help setting it up properly. I would also recommend strongly that you also purchase the WiFi bridge because it adds so many perks. As far as buying the keypad that’s up to you and your personal preferences. I like the product so much that I intend to purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: rob225

customer_reviews.title: No longer dead but not quite working ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got it this week from Amazon, went through the setup , made sure the batteries ( included ) were installed properly and the lock does NOT turn , will not lock and will not unlock, no sound at all from motor. Buying a set of batteries today to try again Update 2/1/19: replaced the “new” batteries in the unit. This time I got a sound out of it, went through the setup, tested the open-close function and got a “lock jammed “ message from the app stating it should be recalibrated... here we go again... At least this time is making noises but am not confident this will work
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: No Wi-Fi!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm working 40 miles from home so I bought this "so called smart Lock" to be able lock/unlock my door from anywhere in the world there was a few choices from $100 and up I choose that because it seems to be a good one and it was the cheapest one when I got it I see there is no wi-fi you have to spend another $65 for a bridge And I need a keypad so I ending up with $210 I'm not sure if I should return this and order a cheaper one But this is definitely A ripp off
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Works when it works, but it's 50/50
customer_reviews.text: I have had this since June 2019. It was working first and then after 30 days, it just randomly works, sometimes works great, sometimes doesn't. Then now, it gets worst, it just like a child, when it throws a tantrum it will not lock or unlock the door. Very frustrating, the customer support, while they respond quickly, it just can't help much since they aren't here, and of course, I can't get a video to show the issue, as it is so random. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Wu

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt function as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Using android with this lock, the auto-unlock feature only works when the auto-lock feature is disabled... So I either need to take my keys out when leaving to lock the door, or take my keys out to unlock it when returning. Not to mention the auto-lock feature can only be set to a timer, and not use geo-fencing like the auto-unlock does, even though the app detects when you leave the area and gives you a notification. That completely negates the utility of this lock, and i am definitely regretting my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: First installation shows jammed - no help to be found
customer_reviews.text: Followed all steps to install the lock and sense units of August Smart Lock. Works manually, can connect to it but it can not lock. Message on the app shows "jammed" and sends me back to calibration mode. After a few retries I factory reset and did all over again. No change. No help online for "Jammed" unit. I saw only one forum mentioning faulty bit inside that was made "too weak". I guess my lock came broken. End result - totally useless and probably not good QC before shipping. Never another August product for me.
customer_reviews.author: SWI

customer_reviews.title: NOT good for Airbnb or short term rental needs
customer_reviews.text: Got for our Airbnb and had issues with it from the beginning.... guests annoyed so many steps to download, error messages when trying to get them in, annoying to have to send invites to each Airbnb guest each time... fine if used for your house but not frequent new guests. Going to store to buy a good old lock box.
customer_reviews.author: Moldychez

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Smart Lock Pro 3rd gen and was so happy, I got this one for the back door. I didn't purchase a Connect for this one, so Bluetooth only (bluetooth could be better but works pretty good for the most part). I like being able to open the door with my iphone or apple watch. What's best is no longer worrying about keys for my visitors. I also like the auto-unlock. The only thing I wish August would improve, is to tighten the out of area zone so I can walk my dog and the door locks when I leave my yard and opens when I return.
customer_reviews.author: D. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Easy to install. I wish I didn't need to but another item to connect this remotely. It is a bit a downer but it is a must to have if you truly want to have a smart lock. The automatic lock/unlock function is great though it doesn't work fast sometimes so you awkwardly wait at the door for the smart lock to unlock the door. But when it works, it is amazingly convenient.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sonmez

customer_reviews.title: Attention to the fine print.
customer_reviews.text: The product is very convenient and nice however August requests location at all times to use the Auto Unlock feature and when doing so after some time Apple notified me of how many times this company pin marked my location(s) on a map miles away from my house. Not cool and a super invasion of privacy especially with me finding out from Apple. 👎🏽
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: August locks are simple to open even a dog can do it.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lock because the upgraded one was easy for my Labrador to open. He would jump up and roll the dial left to unlock the lock. Figuring this lock would be better suited as it was a smaller turn dial I ran into another problem. The door doesn’t lock all the time. Something with the locking mechanism turning the bolt only partial. I think it is the cheap plastic insert you have to use inside the mechanism but after trying it several times and my neighbors calling me that my dog is loose I am throwing this one and the previously bought one away. I would NEVER recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: dougozz

customer_reviews.title: Good design, no change to the front, gets notified, good brand
customer_reviews.text: Overall OK but not for the price. I had a little issue with installation. The cutout was larger. The lock did not come with adapter for large holes. I had to fabricate one myself. Lock features are good. With the adapter, remote operation and notification works well. Bluetooth operation is not very good for me. It is not supposed to open the lock unless I go beyond 600 ft and then return. BT detection in this unit opened the lock when I am walking in front of the house. I had to disable it.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is that you are going to need the bridge to connect remotely. The bridge can cost just as much as the unit. But when you do get the bridge and set everything up, you get instant notification of who accesses and leaves your property. Everyone has there on code. Plus I can lock and unlock remotely. And then I can still use a key to unlock and lock. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment! Trust all of the 1&2* reviews. The case fractured as did the mounting plate while installing. Btw, the Installation is fiddly too. I might as well hand over my keys to the bad guys if it is this fragile. I'll be requesting a refund. Interesting concept but not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wiltse

customer_reviews.title: Expensive piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I do like the fact of look and feel of outside of the lock, but inside technology lacks important features for the price. I had Pro and non-pro locks. Don’t understand why they need 2 connect hubs, for 2 locks @180$ for the hubs if you buy separate. Also it says the door sensor knows when the door is open , I don’t understand when the door is open it still locks which feels that this is piece of crap. I did close the door and the latch didn’t fully work but i never received a notification, I am probably going to return both the locks.
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt play at all with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to have Alexa lock or unlock. Despite enabling the "skill" she continues to tell me to enable the skill or ask August to list my locks. There is 1 cool feature. When I get home my lock senses my phone an auto unlocks the lock. It has yet t o auto lock but I didn't mount the sensor. The range sucks too. You need to be standing close to the lock to se the pp feature. Almost have your hand on the lock...
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: doesn’t work needs to replace battery for every use
customer_reviews.text: This was certainly a fail! I Originally got a used one so it took two weeks for them to reset the previous owners password to me then I installed it then we had to do it again and again and again I’ve replaced the batteries four times because it only works once or twice and then it says the batteries are dead then I would say it was locked and it was actually unlocked and if it was unlocked it was it was locked sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent!
customer_reviews.text: The lock is very inconsistent sometimes it works great and most other times it does not. It fails to unlock the door frequently. It's getting very frustrating to have to deal with how inconsistent this "smart" lock is. I've emailed August twice already through the app and have not heard from anyone yet. If August can advice as to what I need to do to make this lock work it be great, if not or if I don't hear from them in the next few days I will be returning this unit. I'll follow up with an update in a few days. At this point neither the lock is work properly nor customer support.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: In this configuration, your limited to your phone's app functions, which works fine for us.
customer_reviews.text: First, for Internet or Smart Hub functions you will need the August Connect. Secondly, when installing don't over tighten the bracket screws, otherwise you won't be able to lock the wings. Other then that, it installed a operates flawlessly. The other main thing you should remember is with Auto Lock feature MAKE SURE YOU NEVER LEAVE WITHOUT YOUR KEYS OR PHONE. I have the habit of running outside without my KEYS or phone. Other then that, it's an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Tsikusr

customer_reviews.title: Bad and good.
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this lock a lot better than the function of the lock. It knows if it is locked or not but this thing doesn’t know if the door is closed or open. It sometimes works perfectly and sometimes it doesn’t. We never know until we get to the door. It’s about fifty fifty. It’s so annoying when it doesn’t that we’re ready to scrap it. On the other hand, when it works we love it.
customer_reviews.author: J D 8501

customer_reviews.title: They have good costumer service that is available almost all the time
customer_reviews.text: I would avoid, I paired with the doorbell and all other does is Drains my battery it used 10% of my phone battery in less then a day. Also, it rarely works. They have good costumer service that is available almost all the time, but it's because they know they have a bad product and will look for any excuse to blame the user instead of product. like they told me my pixel 2 was fully tested which is why it disconnects everyday and I have to take my doorbell off and reset it to get it to work. There is a reason they always have used ones available...
customer_reviews.author: J Review

customer_reviews.title: You need the connector
customer_reviews.text: The lock itself not bad and with the app is okay. The bluetooth does takes time to get connected to the lock each use. Then I got the connector to get it hooks up to the network now it works with wifi and bluetooth together to bridge the gap and able to using Alexa to lock the door, to unlock you need the passcode to unlock so it is easier to unlock manually than with the voice command, although it helps if you taking out trash with both hands occupied.
customer_reviews.author: Casper Ka

customer_reviews.title: This is real cool
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to install and works great. I can unlock my door or lock it from my phone. I can also unlock and lock the door using one of my Amazon Echo's. I walk up to the door and the lock picks up the phone and unlocks the door. There is little to no wait in unlocking The door is typically unlocked by the time I walk up to the front door. I can still turn the latch myself or use a key if I would like to. I would like to buy one or two more.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: I should have done this a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: Using a key seems so ridiculous, I can hardly believe I resisted an electronic lock for so long. My wife and I feel the kids are so much safer with the auto-lock feature. Walking from the car and up to and though the door without touching anything is amazing - never considered the benefits of the auto-unlock feature. This unit was a best buy. I did my research. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: rshoots

customer_reviews.title: Decent concept but won’t buy another
customer_reviews.text: It’s a decent concept but doesn’t work correctly with my lock - it’s too tight. Also, I’m going to have to do some carpentry work to install the sensor, if I don’t lose it first. it requires an extra part to get the ain’t Internet WiFi functionality. Now it’s just a fancy lock on my door that only works by hand.
customer_reviews.author: WSOgator

customer_reviews.title: I love the feature where it automatically just unlocks the door ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these with a Connect. It took me probably an hour to install all three pieces and to configure the app to my liking. I love the feature where it automatically just unlocks the door when I pull in to my house. Beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: echo

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects at inopportune time.
customer_reviews.text: Lock is great when it works flawlessly. Have to be careful from being locked out. There are times it will not connect via Bluetooth and through the wifi connect device. I got locked out once just from throwing garbage out. Customer service was not able to get the lock back online and I had to call a locksmith to get me back in. Have to reboot the lock every few.mibtsh or it will lose its connection.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with the wifi connect bridge. I haven't tried unlocking the door further away than the driveway, but its been working great so far! I did have an initial issue connecting it to the wifi when it was literally on the other side of the wall, but i set them right next to each other and it was fine. I also had an issue with the lock 1x when the door seemed to have shifted and the lock was slightly stuck...I can't really blame August for not being able to throw a shoulder into the door.
customer_reviews.author: bjjjcr

customer_reviews.title: It works with existing lock but requires wireless bridge for remote locking
customer_reviews.text: So far, it works with all my existing locks. The price is reasonable, especially if you catch it on sale. To be able to remotely lock and unlock, it does require the wireless bridge, which is an extra piece of hardware. Worse still, you will need one wireless bridge for each smart lock. Therefore for each lock, you need to have two pieces of hardware for remote connectivity. I hope they will come out with a wireless hub that can handle multiple locks.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ip

customer_reviews.title: Batteries die after 2 days of use.
customer_reviews.text: I have updated the software through the August app to the latest software. That is an automated process that it simply does once connected. This is my 3rd August lock purchase for my home. They previous same model lasted about a year before physical failure. This is the first lock I have had an issue with the battery drain. After just 2 days my batteries on this model go completely dead. I have seen some additional complaints of the same for this model as well that are matching my problem. It is an issue if you don't bring your keys with you as there is no emergency method other than having your key to access the door upon failure.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for limited space
customer_reviews.text: I have a back door with a big window. Because of this, there is limited space to put a lock. Although this model of August lock looks like it will fit, August locks have "wings" to fit the lock in place. The wings would not open far enough to clear the window frame and I had to return the lock. I have an August lock on my front door that I use with Homekit...no problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Swick

customer_reviews.title: Alexa doesn't work with this smart lock read review
customer_reviews.text: I Just got off phone with August smart Locks 10/12/2018 12:50PM eastern time and they said there is issue with locks and hub not taking Alexa commands defective software but they did say they are working on issue's. I will be shipping my $240.00 worth of non working locks back by next week if issues still exist. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: J. Ames

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Let's make this short. The device has issues that prevent it from functioning consistently. It loses connection everyday. Auto unlock almost never works now. Even the app it comes with freezes constantly now. Some days the app wont even open. It doesn't work the way you think it will without paying $80 dollar for an accessory that allows connection over wifi. It feels like a product still in its beta phase that shouldn't have been released and it is quite old. I'll keep it and place it on my back door that is not used often. Great idea and looks cool but it's not ready yet.
customer_reviews.author: David Jean-Baptiste

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Fyi Doesn't work on Defiant locks
customer_reviews.text: I got it to work perfectly on my Kwikset. Setup was pretty straight forward and I like the smartsense adapter that alerts you when the door is opened (for example, say the door was locked, but not closed. The adapter tells your app its locked but not closed.) But fyi the adapters they provide don't fit on Defiant deadbolts.
customer_reviews.author: G. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, dont buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Horrible! Every time I open the app to lock the door, it fails to connect... Im then standing at the door lookking like an idiot getting mad whike goi g thru the "are you trying to connect to the lock??" " are you standing near the lock?" Omg seriously!? Waste of time and money!!!
customer_reviews.author: zako

customer_reviews.title: This works great! BUT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install and works very well. I set up the automatic unlock and works flawlessly. I didn't notice that it will NOT work with Alexa unless you get the separate connect. So without that no wifi, no remote lock/unlock features. I haven't bought one yet, cause it's another 60 bucks. When I do I'll edit this review.
customer_reviews.author: John Hayes

customer_reviews.title: No thanks.
customer_reviews.text: It does it’s job: locks the door. Otherwise we can only seem to allow one person to utilize the app which is a let down. Also, it could have more stylish options because this will only vibe well in some homes. Very bulky and draws the eye towards it. As far as the installation goes: I now understand why “Locksmith” is it’s own profession.
customer_reviews.author: Shopshop

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. The guided video instructions with the app made installation a breeze. I struggled with locking because I did not calibrate the locking feature. Once calibrated it worked seamlessly. I don’t know if I am going to buy the bridge. I read if you have an Apple TV 4th gen (I don’t) you don’t need to buy the bridge.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: It was not compatible with my lock but I used like 2-3 paper clips and made it work
customer_reviews.text: So far it works well. It was not compatible with my lock but I used like 2-3 paper clips and made it work. Crappy but I was reluctant to make it work. It the lock is compatible with yours, I feel that this is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: ELCaraqueno

customer_reviews.title: Auto-unlock feature only works about 10% of the time
customer_reviews.text: Auto-lock works great, unlocking with my phone works great, but the reason I bought this smartlock, was the auto-unlock feature. It was a nice thought to be able to just walk inside without having to manually unlock the door. It works so infrequently, I don't even try the door handle anymore, I just use my key like with an old-fashioned deadbolt.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

product_meta.title: August Smart Lock - Keyless Home Entry with Your Smartphone - Silver
product_meta.description: Color Name:Silver| Style:Smart Lock OnlySecure keyless entry with your phone. August Smart Lock, 3rd Gen technology - Silver. Standards: Bluetooth Specification v4.0 (Bluetooth Smart).
feature_bullets: Add an August Connect Wi-Fi Bridge (sold separately) to remotely lock/unlock and monitor your door as well to integrate with Alexa, Google Assistant, Airbnb, Home Away Simplisafe and others.

Works with Alexa. Connect your August smart lock to Alexa to lock, unlock and check lock status. Alexa can also provide notifications when your batteries are running low so you can proactively replace them, or you can set up smart reorders to make sure you always have replacement batteries when you need them.

Secure, keyless entry for your smart home. Lock and unlock your door, control keyless access and keep track of who comes and goes, all from your phone. Works with your existing single-cylinder deadbolt
Keep your existing lock and keys. Easily attaches to your existing deadbolt, so everyone can still use their keys.
Send guest keys from anywhere instantly—all from the August app.
Be sure you are secure with Door Sense. Only August has Door Sense to tell you the door is completely closed and locked.
Locks automatically as you leave and unlocks when you arrive.
Simple, DIY installation. Install in about 10 minutes with just a screwdriver.
Control access for anyone. Grant access for a few weeks, a few hours, a few minutes. It’s up to you.

specifications.Included Components: August Smart Lock, DoorSense Sensor, 4 AA Batteries, Lock Adapter and Mounting Hardware
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,971 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
